trans-unit.source: Handle database write conflicts with optimistic concurrency (Windows Store) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Handle database write conflicts with optimistic concurrency (Windows Store) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to handle database write conflicts on both the server and in your Windows Store application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to handle database write conflicts on both the server and in your Windows Store application.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is intended to help you better understand how to handle conflicts that occur when two or more clients write to the same database record in a Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is intended to help you better understand how to handle conflicts that occur when two or more clients write to the same database record in a Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: Two or more clients may write changes to the same item, at the same time, in some scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Two or more clients may write changes to the same item, at the same time, in some scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Without any conflict detection, the last write would overwrite any previous updates even if this was not the desired result.
trans-unit.target: Without any conflict detection, the last write would overwrite any previous updates even if this was not the desired result.

trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Services provides support for detecting and resolving these conflicts.
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Services provides support for detecting and resolving these conflicts.

trans-unit.source: This topic walks you through the steps that allow you to handle database write conflicts on both the server and in your application.
trans-unit.target: This topic walks you through the steps that allow you to handle database write conflicts on both the server and in your application.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial you will add functionality to the quickstart app to handle contentions that can occur when updating the TodoItem database.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial you will add functionality to the quickstart app to handle contentions that can occur when updating the TodoItem database.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Visual Studio 2013 or later.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Visual Studio 2013 or later.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: [Azure Account]
trans-unit.target: [Azure Account]

trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Services NuGet Package 1.1.0 or later.
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Services NuGet Package 1.1.0 or later.

trans-unit.source: To get the latest version, follow these steps below:
trans-unit.target: To get the latest version, follow these steps below:

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the project and right-click the project in Solution Explorer then click Manage Nuget Packages.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the project and right-click the project in Solution Explorer then click Manage Nuget Packages.

trans-unit.source: Expand Online and click Microsoft and .NET.
trans-unit.target: Expand Online and click Microsoft and .NET.

trans-unit.source: In the search text box enter Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In the search text box enter Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Click Install on the Azure Mobile Services NuGet Package.
trans-unit.target: Click Install on the Azure Mobile Services NuGet Package.

trans-unit.source: In this section you will update the TodoList user interface to allow updating the text of each item in a ListBox control.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will update the TodoList user interface to allow updating the text of each item in a ListBox control.

trans-unit.source: The ListBox will contain a CheckBox and TextBox control for each item in the database table.
trans-unit.target: The ListBox will contain a CheckBox and TextBox control for each item in the database table.

trans-unit.source: You will be able to update the text field of the TodoItem.
trans-unit.target: You will be able to update the text field of the TodoItem.

trans-unit.source: The application will handle the LostFocus event from that TextBox to update the item in the database.
trans-unit.target: The application will handle the LostFocus event from that TextBox to update the item in the database.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the TodoList project you downloaded in the [Get started with Mobile Services] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the TodoList project you downloaded in the [Get started with Mobile Services] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: In the Visual Studio Solution Explorer, open MainPage.xaml and replace the ListView definition with the ListView shown below and save the change.
trans-unit.target: In the Visual Studio Solution Explorer, open MainPage.xaml and replace the ListView definition with the ListView shown below and save the change.

trans-unit.source: In the Visual Studio Solution Explorer, open MainPage.cs in the shared project.
trans-unit.target: In the Visual Studio Solution Explorer, open MainPage.cs in the shared project.

trans-unit.source: Add the event handler to the MainPage for the TextBox LostFocus event as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Add the event handler to the MainPage for the TextBox LostFocus event as shown below.

trans-unit.source: In MainPage.cs for the shared project, add the definition for the MainPage UpdateToDoItem() method referenced in the event handler as shown below.
trans-unit.target: In MainPage.cs for the shared project, add the definition for the MainPage UpdateToDoItem() method referenced in the event handler as shown below.

trans-unit.source: The application now writes the text changes to each item back to the database when the TextBox loses focus.
trans-unit.target: The application now writes the text changes to each item back to the database when the TextBox loses focus.

trans-unit.source: Two or more clients may write changes to the same item, at the same time, in some scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Two or more clients may write changes to the same item, at the same time, in some scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Without any conflict detection, the last write would overwrite any previous updates even if this was not the desired result.
trans-unit.target: Without any conflict detection, the last write would overwrite any previous updates even if this was not the desired result.

trans-unit.source: [Optimistic Concurrency Control] assumes that each transaction can commit and therefore does not use any resource locking.
trans-unit.target: [Optimistic Concurrency Control] assumes that each transaction can commit and therefore does not use any resource locking.

trans-unit.source: Before committing a transaction, optimistic concurrency control verifies that no other transaction has modified the data.
trans-unit.target: Before committing a transaction, optimistic concurrency control verifies that no other transaction has modified the data.

trans-unit.source: If the data has been modified, the committing transaction is rolled back.
trans-unit.target: If the data has been modified, the committing transaction is rolled back.

trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Services supports optimistic concurrency control by tracking changes to each item using the __version system property column that is added to each table.
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Services supports optimistic concurrency control by tracking changes to each item using the __version system property column that is added to each table.

trans-unit.source: In this section, we will enable the application to detect these write conflicts through the __version system property.
trans-unit.target: In this section, we will enable the application to detect these write conflicts through the __version system property.

trans-unit.source: The application will be notified by a MobileServicePreconditionFailedException during an update attempt if the record has changed since the last query.
trans-unit.target: The application will be notified by a MobileServicePreconditionFailedException during an update attempt if the record has changed since the last query.

trans-unit.source: It will then be able to make a choice of whether to commit its change to the database or leave the last change to the database intact.
trans-unit.target: It will then be able to make a choice of whether to commit its change to the database or leave the last change to the database intact.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the System Properties for Mobile Services, see [System Properties].
trans-unit.target: For more information on the System Properties for Mobile Services, see [System Properties].

trans-unit.source: Open TodoItem.cs in the shared project and update the TodoItem class definition with the following code to include the __version system property enabling support for write conflict detection.
trans-unit.target: Open TodoItem.cs in the shared project and update the TodoItem class definition with the following code to include the __version system property enabling support for write conflict detection.

trans-unit.source: When using untyped tables, enable optimistic concurrency by adding the Version flag to the SystemProperties of the table.
trans-unit.target: When using untyped tables, enable optimistic concurrency by adding the Version flag to the SystemProperties of the table.

trans-unit.source: //Enable optimistic concurrency by retrieving __version todoTable.SystemProperties |= MobileServiceSystemProperties.Version;
trans-unit.target: //Enable optimistic concurrency by retrieving __version todoTable.SystemProperties |= MobileServiceSystemProperties.Version;

trans-unit.source: By adding the Version property to the TodoItem class, the application will be notified with a MobileServicePreconditionFailedException exception during an update if the record has changed since the last query.
trans-unit.target: By adding the Version property to the TodoItem class, the application will be notified with a MobileServicePreconditionFailedException exception during an update if the record has changed since the last query.

trans-unit.source: This exception includes the latest version of the item from the server.
trans-unit.target: This exception includes the latest version of the item from the server.

trans-unit.source: In MainPage.cs for the shared project, add the following code to handle the exception in the UpdateToDoItem() method.
trans-unit.target: In MainPage.cs for the shared project, add the following code to handle the exception in the UpdateToDoItem() method.

trans-unit.source: In MainPage.cs, add the definition for the ResolveConflict() method referenced in UpdateToDoItem().
trans-unit.target: In MainPage.cs, add the definition for the ResolveConflict() method referenced in UpdateToDoItem().

trans-unit.source: Notice that in order to resolve the conflict, you set the local item's version to the updated version from the server before committing the user's decision.
trans-unit.target: Notice that in order to resolve the conflict, you set the local item's version to the updated version from the server before committing the user's decision.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, you will continually encounter the conflict.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, you will continually encounter the conflict.

trans-unit.source: In this section you will build a Windows Store app package to install the app on a second machine or virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will build a Windows Store app package to install the app on a second machine or virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Then you will run the app on both machines generating a write conflict to test the code.
trans-unit.target: Then you will run the app on both machines generating a write conflict to test the code.

trans-unit.source: Both instances of the app will attempt to update the same item's text property requiring the user to resolve the conflict.
trans-unit.target: Both instances of the app will attempt to update the same item's text property requiring the user to resolve the conflict.

trans-unit.source: Create a Windows Store app package to install on second machine or virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Create a Windows Store app package to install on second machine or virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: To do this, click Project->Store->Create App Packages in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: To do this, click Project->Store->Create App Packages in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: On the Create Your Packages screen, click No as this package will not be uploaded to the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: On the Create Your Packages screen, click No as this package will not be uploaded to the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: Then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Then click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Select and Configure Packages screen, accept the defaults and click Create.
trans-unit.target: On the Select and Configure Packages screen, accept the defaults and click Create.

trans-unit.source: On the Package Creation Completed screen, click the Output location link to open the package location.
trans-unit.target: On the Package Creation Completed screen, click the Output location link to open the package location.

trans-unit.source: Copy the package folder, "todolist1.0.0.0AnyCPUDebugTest", to the second machine.
trans-unit.target: Copy the package folder, "todolist1.0.0.0AnyCPUDebugTest", to the second machine.

trans-unit.source: On that machine, open the package folder and right click on the Add-AppDevPackage.ps1 PowerShell script and click Run with PowerShell as shown below.
trans-unit.target: On that machine, open the package folder and right click on the Add-AppDevPackage.ps1 PowerShell script and click Run with PowerShell as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Follow the prompts to install the app.
trans-unit.target: Follow the prompts to install the app.

trans-unit.source: Run instance 1 of the app in Visual Studio by clicking Debug->Start Debugging.
trans-unit.target: Run instance 1 of the app in Visual Studio by clicking Debug->Start Debugging.

trans-unit.source: On the Start screen of the second machine, click the down arrow to see "Apps by name".
trans-unit.target: On the Start screen of the second machine, click the down arrow to see "Apps by name".

trans-unit.source: Then click the todolist app to run instance 2 of the app.
trans-unit.target: Then click the todolist app to run instance 2 of the app.

trans-unit.source: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: In instance 1 of the app, update the text of the last item to Test Write 1, then click another text box so that the LostFocus event handler updates the database.
trans-unit.target: In instance 1 of the app, update the text of the last item to Test Write 1, then click another text box so that the LostFocus event handler updates the database.

trans-unit.source: The screenshot below shows an example.
trans-unit.target: The screenshot below shows an example.

trans-unit.source: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: At this point the corresponding item in instance 2 of the app has an old version of the item.
trans-unit.target: At this point the corresponding item in instance 2 of the app has an old version of the item.

trans-unit.source: In that instance of the app, enter Test Write 2 for the text property.
trans-unit.target: In that instance of the app, enter Test Write 2 for the text property.

trans-unit.source: Then click another text box so the LostFocus event handler attempts to update the database with the old _version property.
trans-unit.target: Then click another text box so the LostFocus event handler attempts to update the database with the old _version property.

trans-unit.source: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Since the __version value used with the update attempt didn't match the server __version value, the Mobile Services SDK throws a MobileServicePreconditionFailedException allowing the app to resolve this conflict.
trans-unit.target: Since the __version value used with the update attempt didn't match the server __version value, the Mobile Services SDK throws a MobileServicePreconditionFailedException allowing the app to resolve this conflict.

trans-unit.source: To resolve the conflict, you can click Commit Local Text to commit the values from instance 2.
trans-unit.target: To resolve the conflict, you can click Commit Local Text to commit the values from instance 2.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, click Leave Server Text to discard the values in instance 2, leaving the values from instance 1 of the app committed.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, click Leave Server Text to discard the values in instance 2, leaving the values from instance 1 of the app committed.

trans-unit.source: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can detect and resolve write conflicts in server scripts.
trans-unit.target: You can detect and resolve write conflicts in server scripts.

trans-unit.source: This is a good idea when you can use scripted logic instead of user interaction to resolve the conflict.
trans-unit.target: This is a good idea when you can use scripted logic instead of user interaction to resolve the conflict.

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will add a server side script to the TodoItem table for the application.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will add a server side script to the TodoItem table for the application.

trans-unit.source: The logic this script will use to resolve conflicts is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The logic this script will use to resolve conflicts is as follows:

trans-unit.source: If the TodoItem's complete field is set to true, then it is considered completed and text can no longer be changed.
trans-unit.target: If the TodoItem's complete field is set to true, then it is considered completed and text can no longer be changed.

trans-unit.source: If the TodoItem's complete field is still false, then attempts to update text will be comitted.
trans-unit.target: If the TodoItem's complete field is still false, then attempts to update text will be comitted.

trans-unit.source: The following steps walk you through adding the server update script and testing it.
trans-unit.target: The following steps walk you through adding the server update script and testing it.

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click your app.
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click your app.

trans-unit.source: Click the Data tab, then click the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Click the Data tab, then click the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Click Script, then select the Update operation.
trans-unit.target: Click Script, then select the Update operation.

trans-unit.source: Replace the existing script with the following function, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Replace the existing script with the following function, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: Run the todolist app on both machines.
trans-unit.target: Run the todolist app on both machines.

trans-unit.source: Change the TodoItem text for the last item in instance 2.
trans-unit.target: Change the TodoItem text for the last item in instance 2.

trans-unit.source: Then click another text box so the LostFocus event handler updates the database.
trans-unit.target: Then click another text box so the LostFocus event handler updates the database.

trans-unit.source: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: In instance 1 of the app, enter a different value for the last text property.
trans-unit.target: In instance 1 of the app, enter a different value for the last text property.

trans-unit.source: Then click another text box so the LostFocus event handler attempts to update the database with an incorrect __version property.
trans-unit.target: Then click another text box so the LostFocus event handler attempts to update the database with an incorrect __version property.

trans-unit.source: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Notice that no exception was encountered in the app since the server script resolved the conflict allowing the update since the item is not marked complete.
trans-unit.target: Notice that no exception was encountered in the app since the server script resolved the conflict allowing the update since the item is not marked complete.

trans-unit.source: To see that the update was truly successful, click Refresh in instance 2 to re-query the database.
trans-unit.target: To see that the update was truly successful, click Refresh in instance 2 to re-query the database.

trans-unit.source: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: In instance 1, click the check box to complete the last Todo item.
trans-unit.target: In instance 1, click the check box to complete the last Todo item.

trans-unit.source: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: In instance 2, try to update the last TodoItem's text and trigger the LostFocus event.
trans-unit.target: In instance 2, try to update the last TodoItem's text and trigger the LostFocus event.

trans-unit.source: In response to the conflict, the script resolved it by refusing the update because the item was already completed.
trans-unit.target: In response to the conflict, the script resolved it by refusing the update because the item was already completed.

trans-unit.source: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 1 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: App Instance 2 <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrated how to enable a Windows Store app to handle write conflicts when working with data in Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrated how to enable a Windows Store app to handle write conflicts when working with data in Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Next, consider completing one of the following Windows Store tutorials:
trans-unit.target: Next, consider completing one of the following Windows Store tutorials:

trans-unit.source:
[Add authentication to your app]
Learn how to authenticate users of your app.
trans-unit.target:
[Add authentication to your app]
Learn how to authenticate users of your app.

trans-unit.source:
[Add push notifications to your app]
Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app with Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target:
[Add push notifications to your app]
Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app with Mobile Services.
